sentences.english: Temples and statues decay, but books survieve.
sentences.chinese: 寺廟會倒坍，神像會朽爛，而書卻經久長存。

sentences.english: Coal of all kinds originated from the decay of plants.
sentences.chinese: 各種煤都是由植物的朽爛形成的。

sentences.english: Imagine what it would be like to have rotten bones. Picture a person whose bones have rotted.
sentences.chinese: 試想一下身體的骨頭朽爛，會是怎樣的一回事。

sentences.english: The poor were housed in dingy rotting buildings.
sentences.chinese: 窮人住在昏暗的朽爛的房子裏。

sentences.english: He struck off the rotten branches with an axe.
sentences.chinese: 他用斧頭砍掉了朽爛的樹枝。

sentences.english: The memory of the righteous is a blessing, but the name of the wicked will rot.
sentences.chinese: 義人的紀念被稱讚，惡人的名字必朽爛。

sentences.english: Therefore will I be unto Ephraim as a moth, and to the house of Judah as rottenness.
sentences.chinese: 我使以法蓮如蟲蛀之物，使猶大家如朽爛之木。

sentences.english: But envy is the rottenness of the bones.
